name: Multisim
description: NI Multisim (formerly MultiSIM) is an electronic schematic capture and simulation program , a suite of circuit design programs

Keyboard Shortcuts.key: Delete all broken wires from the diagram
Delete a wire you are in the process of creating

Instructions.val: A blank schematic Circuit 1 is automatically created. To create a new schematic click on File New Schematic Capture. To save the schematic click on File /Save As. To open an existing file click on File/ Open in the toolbar
To Place Components click on Place/Components. On the Select Component Window click on Group to select the components needed for the circuit. Click OK to place the component on the schematic
To rotate the components right click on the Resistor to flip the component on 90 Clockwise (Ctrl +R) and 90 Counter Clockwise (Ctrl+Shift+R)

To connect resistors click on Place/Wire drag and place the wire. Components can also be connected by clicking the mouse over the terminal edge of one component and dragging to the edge of another component
To change component values double click on the component this brings up a window that display the properties of the component
All circuits must be grounded before the circuit can be simulated. Click on Ground in the toolbar to ground the circuit. If the circuit is not grounded Multisim will not run the simulation
To simulate the completed circuit Click on Simulate/Run or F5. This feature can also be accessed from the toolbar

Components.val: Use the Multimeter to measure AC or DC voltage or current, and resistance or decibel loss between two nodes in a circuit. To use the Multimeter click on the Multimeter button in the Instruments toolbar
The wattmeter measures power. It is used to measure the magnitude of the active power
The ammeter offers advantages over the multimeter for measuring current in a circuit. Always connect the ammeter in series with the load
The Voltmeter offers advantages over the multimeter for measuring voltage in a circuit. Always connect the voltmeter in parallel with the load
